intro: Myosotis matritensis, commonly known as the Madrid forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Spain. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, while its stems are erect and branched. It is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
